arm_group.description: Girls who are diagnosed with Turner syndrome because of concerns raised by an abnormal fetal ultrasound.

Girls who are diagnosed with Turner syndrome because their mothers had an amniocentesis for a reason other than an abnormal fetal ultrasound concerning for Turner syndrome. For example an amniocentesis was done because of advanced maternal age or because of an abnormal triple screen or because another condition was being screened for such as trisomy 21.

brief_summary.textblock:
The goal of this study is to compare the features of Turner syndrome in girls who are
      diagnosed before birth because of fetal concerns versus those who are diagnosed when their
      mother has an amniocentesis for another reason.

detailed_description.textblock:
This is an observational study which will look at girls who are diagnosed with Turner
      syndrome before they are born. Girls will be divided into two groups: 1) those diagnosed
      because of features seen on ultrasound which raised the question of Turner syndrome and 2)
      those diagnosed incidentally when their mother had an amniocentesis for another reason such
      as advanced maternal age.

      No clinical procedures nor interventions will be done as part of this data collection study
      which will occur for the first 3 to 6 years of the girl's life. The investigators will be
      looking to see if girls who are diagnosed incidentally have less features of Turner syndrome
      than those girls who are diagnosed because of fetal ultrasound.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Turner syndrome diagnosed prenatally

          -  Less than 4 months of age at time of enrollment

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Turner syndrome diagnosed postnatally

          -  Older than 4 months of age at time of enrollment

study_pop.textblock: Girls who are diagnosed with Turner syndrome prenatally.

clinical_study.official_title: National Collaborative Study of Girls Prenatally Diagnosed With Turner Syndrome Karyotypes

primary_outcome.description: Girls diagnosed with Turner syndrome by fetal ascertainment will have more signs of Turner syndrome than girls diagnosed by maternal ascertainment
primary_outcome.measure: Number of signs of Turner syndrome

reference.citation: Gunther DF, Eugster E, Zagar AJ, Bryant CG, Davenport ML, Quigley CA. Ascertainment bias in Turner syndrome: new insights from girls who were diagnosed incidentally in prenatal life. Pediatrics. 2004 Sep;114(3):640-4.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Do girls with Turner syndrome ascertained by fetal ascertainment grow differently than girls ascertained by maternal ascertainment.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case Control, Time Perspective: Prospective
